description: Representative Maxine Waters, the top Democrat on the Financial Services Committee, predicted Wednesday that she and Chairman Patrick McHenry would soon have a deal on legislation regulating stablecoins, and said she’s pushing for marijuana banking legislation as well.
title: Key Democrat Touts Progress on Stablecoin, Marijuana Legislation

description: The US is pushing Israel for information about reports that mass graves were uncovered at two hospital complexes in the Gaza Strip after Israeli forces raided the facilities.
title: US Presses Israel on Claims of Mass Graves at Gaza Hospitals

description: Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez announced that he may resign over right-wing attacks against him and his wife, a move that would push Spain into unchartered political territory and raise the possibility of a new general election.
title: Sanchez Threatens to Quit, Putting Spain on Course for Elections

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, economics enterprise reporter Rich Miller looks ahead to two key pieces of data coming this week that will have a big impact on the presidential campaign. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Good News for Biden on Growth, Bad News on Inflation Fight

description: Colombian President Gustavo Petro called on congress to eliminate a controversial fee on pension fund assets.
title: Petro Calls on Colombian Congress to Eliminate Proposed Pension Fee

description: The US Supreme Court has never considered whether former presidents are immune from criminal prosecution for acts they took in office. Before Donald Trump, the court never needed to.
title: Do Presidents Have Immunity? Trump’s Supreme Court Case Explained

description: Russia vetoed a United Nations Security Council resolution that would have reaffirmed a global commitment against deploying nuclear weapons in space, rebuffing US efforts to shine a spotlight on Moscow’s reported plans to do so.
title: Russia Blocks US Bid to Reaffirm Ban on Nuclear Weapons in Space

description: The Biden administration’s plan for throttling power-plant pollution is expected to drive far greater reductions of greenhouse gas emissions than initially expected, even as US electricity demand climbs.
title: Biden’s Power-Plant Plan Will Have Bigger Carbon-Cutting Reach

description: National security advisors and senior officials from around the world are set to meet in Doha this weekend to discuss plans for a summit on Ukraine’s conditions for a settlement with Russia, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Qatar Will Host Meeting to Discuss Ukrainian Proposal to End War

description: New York Mayor Eric Adams reversed proposed cuts to the police department and early childhood education after the city was able to lower the cost of migrant care and tax receipts came in better than forecast.
title: NYC Mayor Restores Funding for Police as Migrant Costs Stabilize

description: President Joe Biden has been “faithfully” following his predecessor’s footsteps when it comes to US-Cuba relations, according to Deputy Foreign Minister Carlos Fernandez de Cossio.
title: Biden ‘Faithfully’ Follows Trump’s Steps on Cuba, Minister Says

description: Fossil fuel use will be banned in new federal buildings starting in 2030 under a Biden administration rule that the natural gas industry fought for more than a decade.
title: Biden Bans the Use of Fossil Fuels in New Federal Buildings

description: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said he’s considering resigning due to the attacks that he and his wife have faced in recent weeks.
title: Spain’s Sanchez Says He’s Considering Quitting as Premier

description: Democrat Donald Payne Jr., a six-term congressman from New Jersey, died Wednesday at the age of 65, creating a new vacancy in the narrowly divided US House.
title: Donald Payne Jr., Democratic Congressman From NJ, Dies at 65

description: Zimbabwe’s President Emmerson Mnangagwa has re-appointed Winston Chitando as the southern African nation’s mines minister, a post he held before last year’s elections.
title: Zimbabwe’s Mnangagwa Names New Mines Minister in Mini-Reshuffle

description: President Joe Biden’s campaign says it will continue to use its account on TikTok even after he signed legislation into law that forces its parent company, Beijing-based ByteDance Ltd., to sell its stake or face a ban in US app stores.
title: Biden’s Campaign Plans to Stay on TikTok Despite Divestment Law

description: Congressional passage Tuesday of authority granting President Joe Biden new powers to seize Russian dollar assets to aid Ukraine has intensified debate over the potential consequences of foreign demand for US Treasuries and use of the dollar.
title: Russia Asset Seizure Law Spurs Yellen Praise, Dollar Angst

description: French President Emmanuel Macron leaned on Kosovo’s premier to step up efforts toward European integration, telling the Balkan leader that he needs to make progress in offering a degree of autonomy to the country’s Serb minority.
title: Macron Pressures Kosovo’s Kurti to Make Progress on Integration

description: Almost half of Britain’s tax collectors are failing to meet the government department’s requirement for staff to work from the office three days a week, according to its top official.
title: Almost Half of UK Tax Collectors Miss Target to Work in Office

description: Venezuelan opposition candidate Edmundo González said that if he wins this year’s election he’d be open to talks with President Nicolás Maduro to ensure a smooth transfer of power.
title: Venezuelan Opposition Leader Says He’d Be Open to Talks With Maduro

description: The arrest on bribery charges of one of Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu’s closest allies has weakened his position ahead of a potential government shuffle by President Vladimir Putin, according to people with knowledge of the situation.
title: Russian Defense Minister Shoigu Weakened by Arrest of Key Ally

description: UK-German ties appeared under strain as recently as last month, with British officials lobbying Berlin to send Ukraine more long-range missiles. On Wednesday, there was little sign of such tension as Chancellor Olaf Scholz hosted Rishi Sunak on his first trip to Germany as prime minister.
title: Sunak, Scholz Find Common Cause to Support Each Other on Defense

description: Donald Trump asked a judge to toss two counts in the Georgia election-fraud case, arguing that local Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis can’t charge him with making false filings in federal court.
title: Trump Asks Georgia Judge to Toss Two Counts in Election Case

description: TikTok said legislation passed by the US Congress Tuesday evening that would force its Chinese parent company to sell its stake or face a total ban of the app in America is “unconstitutional,” and the company will challenge it in court.
title: TikTok Says Law Is on Its Side as It Readies to Fight US Ban

description: The United Nations’ atomic watchdog expects to meet senior Iranian officials next month to discuss growing concern the Persian Gulf nation could build a nuclear weapon in response to escalating tension with Israel.
title: Iran’s Nuclear Saber Rattling Raises More Alarm at UN Watchdog

description: President Joe Biden signed a $95 billion national security package into law and said assistance to Ukraine would begin to move within “hours,” capping off a bruising fight with Republicans over long-delayed assistance for Kyiv and other besieged US allies.
title: Biden Signs Aid Bill, Orders Ukraine Help to Flow Within Hours

description: A St. Petersburg court froze the Russian assets of JPMorgan Chase & Co. pending consideration of a lawsuit from the country’s second-largest bank that seeks to recover about $440 million.
title: Russian Court Freezes JPMorgan Assets Under $440 Million Claim

description: A prominent Iranian hip hop musician who was arrested for his protest lyrics and social media posts has been sentenced to death by an Iranian court, the reformist Shargh newspaper reported.
title: Iran Hands Death Sentence to Rap Star Arrested for Protest Songs

description: Italy and Germany have clashed over whether Group of Seven nations should include a reference to nuclear power as part of the green transition at an upcoming summit of energy ministers, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Germany Is Holding Up Italy’s Push for G-7 to Back Nuclear Power

description: Turkey’s central bank probably won more time before having to consider another increase in interest rates, a month after surprising markets with a big hike and delivering additional tightening since then.
title: Turkey Is in ‘Whatever It Takes’ Mode But Rate Hike Now Unlikely

description: South Africa’s state prosecuting authority urged the presidency to help resolve an impasse with the United Arab Emirates over what it described as the Gulf nation’s lack of “willingness” to help extradite Atul and Rajesh Gupta, who are wanted on charges of money laundering and fraud.
title: South Africa Sends Top Officials to UAE Over Gupta Extraditions

description: French President Emmanuel Macron, who was instrumental in making Ursula von der Leyen the European Commission president five years ago, is now in talks with fellow EU leaders to find a different candidate — such as Mario Draghi — to fill the top job.
title: Macron Is Gauging Support for a Plan to Install Draghi in the Top EU Job

description: The Israeli military said it struck around 40 sites linked to Hezbollah in southern Lebanon on Wednesday.
title: Israel Strikes Around 40 Hezbollah Sites in South Lebanon

description: Joerg Wuttke, the outspoken former president of the European Union Chamber of Commerce in China, is leaving Beijing after about three decades to take up a role with an advisory firm in Washington.
title: One of Europe’s Top Businessmen in China Moves to Washington

description: Moldovan prosecutors filed corruption charges against the pro-Russian leader of an autonomous region as concerns mount about Kremlin efforts to destabilize the nation’s path into the European Union.
title: Moldova Charges Governor Who Met With Putin in Corruption Probe

description: Russia began moves to compel the country’s largest private bank to redomicile by seeking to suspend the ownership rights of its foreign-registered shareholders.
title: Russia Pushes Its Largest Private Bank to Redomicile at Home

description: Welcome to the Year of the Elections, Bloomberg’s newsletter on the votes that matter to markets, business and policy amid the most fragmented geo-economic landscape in decades.
title: A Reckoning at Home for South Africa’s Governing ANC

description: Major US companies could face lawsuits from their own shareholders for making political donations, according to a new legal strategy progressives are advocating to reign in corporate influence on elections.
title: Corporate Political Donations Poised to Spark Shareholder Lawsuits

description: Each day, Bloomberg journalists take you across a selection of towns and cities as they gear up for the big vote.
title: In Jammu, Modi Seeks Approval for Scrapping Kashmir Autonomy: India Votes

description: Turkey’s return to a more conventional approach to monetary policy is boosting investor confidence, setting the stage for capital inflows and underpinning HSBC Holdings Plc’s bullish stance on the nation’s assets.
title: Turkey’s ‘Orthodox’ Pivot Makes Lira a Favorite for HSBC

description: Ryanair Holdings Plc Chief Executive Officer Michael O’Leary weighed into the UK’s controversial plan to deport refugees to Rwanda, saying he would “happily” do the flights if he had the available aircraft.
title: Ryanair CEO Says He’d ‘Happily’ Offer Rwanda Deportation Flights

description: The Alternative for Germany’s lead candidate in the European Parliament elections said he’ll fire an assistant accused of spying for China and vowed to continue campaigning for the far-right party ahead of the June vote.
title: German AfD Lawmaker to Fire Aide Accused of Spying for China

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Risks of War Are Weighing on Europe’s Leaders

description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken has arrived in China on a mission to press Beijing on issues including its support for Russia and industrial overcapacity, with the threat of new US sanctions looming over the visit.
title: Blinken Lands in China For Tense Talks as US Sanctions Loom

description: This is a special Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House correspondent Stephanie Lai reviews the results of the latest Bloomberg News/Morning Consult poll. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Biden Falters in Poll With Voters Souring on Economic Outlook

description: Voters support billionaires tax, trimming benefits for wealthy
title: Ultra-Rich Should Pay to Save Social Security, Swing-State Voter Poll Shows

description: The president is trailing Donald Trump in six of seven swing states as a majority of poll respondents see the economy worsening by the end of the year.
title: Biden’s Gains Against Trump Vanish on Deep Economic Pessimism, Poll Shows

description: The US Supreme Court will consider just how far states can go in prohibiting abortion Wednesday as it weighs whether emergency room doctors nationwide can perform the procedure when a pregnant woman’s health is at serious risk.
title: Emergency Abortion Clash at Supreme Court Tests Strictest Bans

description: Russian Deputy Defense Minister Timur Ivanov, who was the focus of an investigation by the late opposition leader Alexey Navalny’s team in the first year of the war on Ukraine, has been detained by investigators on allegations of bribery.
title: Russia Detains Deputy Defense Minister on Bribery Charge

description: France is asking the European Union to set up a new sanctions regime to target Russian disinformation and election interference operations worldwide.
title: France Proposes New EU Sanctions to Fight Russian Disinformation

description: Italy’s return to a trajectory of rising debt risks complicating the task of managing the euro zone’s third-biggest economy and could stoke political tensions, according to Fitch Ratings.
title: Italy’s ‘Superbonus’-Stoked Debt Draws Fitch’s Attention

description: A standoff between pro-Palestinian demonstrators and officials at Columbia University passed a midnight deadline with no clear breakthrough in a dispute that has drawn a national spotlight to campus politics over the Middle East.
title: Protest Deadline Passes at Columbia as Talks Fail to End Impasse

description: North Korea sent its highest-level delegation to Iran in about five years as the US raised concerns that arms sales from Pyongyang and Tehran have helped fuel conflicts in the Middle East and Russia’s war in Ukraine.
title: North Korea Stokes Arms Concerns by Sending a Rare Delegation to Iran

description: A small sampling of lawmakers from Japan’s ruling Liberal Democratic Party indicates there’s political opposition to a Bank of Japan interest rate hike over the next few months.
title: Some LDP Members Oppose BOJ Rate Hikes Ahead of Political Events

description: Argentine President Javier Milei’s economic team sees monthly inflation slowing much faster this year than analysts anticipate, a rare insight into his advisers’ projections as he tries to pull the country out of crisis.
title: Milei’s Team Sees Argentina Inflation Slowing Faster Than Economist Survey

description: A court concluded the state can enforce the 1864 law.
title: Arizona House Advances Repeal of Near-Total Abortion Ban to the Senate

description: The Nordic nation is upgrading its civil defenses, and energy infrastructure is a priority.
title: Sweden’s Plan for Worst-Case Scenario: War Spreading in Europe

description: China called on the US to rein in support for Taiwan, after a bill providing some $8 billion in aid for the island was approved by the Senate in Washington.
title: China Repeats Criticism of US Taiwan Aid as Bill Passes Senate

description: Colombian senators approved President Gustavo Petro’s pension reform in a victory for the unpopular leftist leader.
title: Colombia’s Petro Gets Victory as Senate Approves Pension Reform

description: The Senate voted to send a foreign aid package that includes sanctions on Iran’s oil sector to President Joe Biden, who has said he will sign the legislation into law.
title: Senate Sends Aid Package With Iran Oil Sanctions to Biden

description: The US Senate voted to ban TikTok’s ownership by Chinese parent ByteDance Ltd., setting the stage for a constitutional clash over whether the prohibition deprives US users of their First Amendment free speech rights.
title: TikTok Ban-or-Divest Bill Set to Be Signed by Biden Into Law

description: El barómetro electoral de Bloomberg de México 2024 muestra que la candidata oficialista Sheinbaum amplió su ventaja a 29 puntos en la carrera presidencial
title: Sheinbaum amplía su ventaja a 29 puntos en la contienda electoral

description: Bloomberg's poll tracker for the Mexico 2024 elections shows that the frontrunner Claudia Sheinbaum’s lead is growing, now at 29 points ahead of main opposition rival Xóchitl Gálvez
title: Sheinbaum Lead Widens to 29 Points in Mexico Presidential Race

description: The Senate passed a long-delayed $95 billion emergency aid package for Ukraine and other besieged US allies, clearing the way for resumed arms shipments to Kyiv within days.
title: US Senate Passes Ukraine Aid, Arms Shipments to Resume in Days

description: Solomon Islands Prime Minister Manasseh Sogavare has failed to win a majority in parliamentary elections, setting the stage for coalition negotiations in coming weeks to form the next government.
title: Pro-China Solomon Islands PM Fails to Win Majority After Elections

description: The European Union launched an investigation into China’s medical device procurement, as the bloc seeks to address concerns that Beijing’s policies unfairly favor domestic suppliers.
title: EU Opens Investigation Into China’s Medical Device Procurement

description: Former US President Donald Trump met former Japanese Prime Minister Taro Aso on Tuesday night in New York amid rising concerns over the dollar hovering around a 34-year high versus the yen.
title: Trump Meets Former Japan Premier Aso Amid Weak Yen Concern

description: Venezuela’s President Nicolás Maduro said the United Nation’s Human Rights workers he expelled more than two months ago can return to Venezuela during a fourth visit from the International Criminal Court’s prosecutor Karim Khan.
title: Venezuela Accepts Return of Expelled UN Human Rights Staff

description: Incumbent Brian Fitzpatrick won the Republican primary for the US House seat in Pennsylvania’s 1st Congressional District in the Philadelphia suburbs, AP said.
title: Fitzpatrick Repels Primary Challenge for Pennsylvania House Seat

description: Trump-backed former Bridgewater Associates chief executive officer Dave McCormick won the Republican Primary for the US Senate seat in Pennsylvania, AP projected.
title: McCormick Wins GOP Primary for Pennsylvania Senate Seat
